message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest heart failure, which is supported by his past hospitalization and difficulty breathing. Enalapril is an ACE inhibitor that can help improve symptoms and survival in heart failure patients. Digoxin is used to control heart rate but may not necessarily improve symptoms or survival in heart failure patients. Amiodarone is an antiarrhythmic drug and Amlodipine is a calcium channel blocker, neither of which directly treat heart failure.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms, especially difficulty breathing and coughing with pinkish sputum, suggest heart failure. Enalapril is an ACE inhibitor and is used in the management of heart failure to improve the prognosis. Digoxin is also used for heart failure but is not the first-line medication. Amiodarone is used for cardiac arrhythmias and amlodipine is used for hypertension, but neither is the best choice for this patient’s condition.
